title: U.S. passenger-miles : Intercity/Amtrak 2007 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing U.S. passenger-miles in millions, with a total of 12 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2013 to 2009.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2016 to 2013.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2018 to 2016.
Similarly, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2009 to 2007.
gold: This graph shows Amtrak/Intercity passenger-miles traveled in the United States from 2007 to 2018 . In 2018 , passengers traveled around 6.36 billion miles by Intercity/Amtrak . Amtrak , also known as the National Railroad Passenger Corporation , is a publicly funded service .
